item.description:
Hello, everyone!

The weather has been downright dreadful lately, but soon... it will be lovely! (Hopefully!) And with that in mind, it's (finally!) time for the Boston Japanese & English Language Club's annual Ohanami event! (Please note: this replaces Prudential Meetup for April 30th.)

 

Who/What You Should Bring: 
Feel free to bring food, non-alcoholic drinks, guests, etc. If you do not plan on bringing any food, please bring a donation ($5 per person recommended) to help cover the costs of the snacks I will bring for everyone. I will also bring Japanese tea and other non-alcoholic drinks. Additionally, if anyone has any that they wouldn't mind letting us use, we need things such as blankets, rain tarps and old sheets to sit on.

 

Location:
We will be on the Public Gardens side (not the Common side!). I'm planning to try and find a location near the place we were last year, which is the grassy area near Arlington street. Look for us from the bridge near the swan boats.

 

Travel:
The closest station to our location is Arlington Station on the Green Line, but Boylston or Park Street stations are also good options. If you get off at Boylston or Part Street, please walk through Boston Commons to the Boston Public Garden.

 

After Ohanami:
If anyone wants to bring something like a soccer ball or frisbee, we can organize games for the afternoon. Some of us will probably go out for dinner and/or drinks afterwards.

 

If you have any questions, feel free to post here or send me a message. I'm looking forward to seeing everyone!

Thanks! ^^
Kaylee
